Class TilePuzzle

java.lang.Object
  TilePuzzle

public class TilePuzzle
extends Object

The TilePuzzle class simulates a tile/number shifting puzzle. It contains an array that features numbers up to (area - 1), with a blank space.

Constructor Detail

TilePuzzle

public TilePuzzle(int[][] newGrid)
The constructor for the program. It accepts a 2D array of integers and sets that array to be it's own. Also, it analyses the array's length in terms of rows and columns and sets it to it's own variables.

Parameters:
newGrid - the 2D integer array for the puzzle.
Method Detail

moveTile

public boolean moveTile(int cellToMove)
The moveTile method accepts an int that represents the numerical value of a tile. The method then looks through it's grid to see what position that tile is at, and searches in compass directions (north, south, east, west) if there is a blank spot next to the tile. If there is, then the method swaps the blank space with the value, and returns true. It also adds one to numMoves if a move was successful.

Parameters:
cellToMove - the integer value of the tile to move.
Returns:
whether the move was completed, as a boolean.

hasWon

public boolean hasWon()
The hasWon method checks if there is a winning combination on the grid. This combination is if the array has been sorted, in sequencial order, with the blank space at the bottom right. For example, if the array was 3x3 wide, then the array must have the values from 1 to 8 in decending order with a blank space at the end.

Returns:
if the victory conditions have been met, as a boolean.

numTileMoves

public int numTileMoves()
A getter method that returns the number of moves the user has made so far.

Returns:
the total number moves made as an int.

maxTileValue

public int maxTileValue()
It searches and returns the greatest numerical value that is on the tiles/array.

Returns:
the greatest value of the tiles/array, as an int.

getGrid

public int[][] getGrid()
A method that simply returns the address of the array that the TilePuzzle object is using, permitting further use of that array.

Returns:
the address of the grid in use.

equals

public boolean equals(TilePuzzle puzzle)
A method that tests if two grids in two TilePuzzle's are the same. It will return false if either the dimensions of the grids are different, and also if the elements inside the grid are not the same. It will return true if equal.

Parameters:
puzzle - a TilePuzzle object.
Returns:
whether if the current and given TilePuzzle object grids are similar, as a boolean.

toString

public String toString()
This method returns the layout of the grid in String format. It breaks differnt lines with the\n characters, and also replaces the blank space, represented as a -1 to a *.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
the format of the grid, as a String.
